body.p: Which group of cells indicates stratified epithelial cells? Click on the group of cells you think is the answer.

feedback.p: Correct. The cells of the terminal bronchioles are example of cuboidal cells which are a transition from the cells of the bronchial tree to the conduction zone of the alveoli.
Incorrect. Type I alveolar cells are an example of squamous cells, which have a squashed flat appearance. Cuboidal cells look very similar to a cube.
Incorrect. The Nares exemplify stratified epithelial cells. Not a single layer of cube like cells.
Incorrect. The Bronchial tree is an example of pseudostratified epithelial which have a columnar shape not a cubodial shape.

body.p: Which group of cells will allow diffusion to occur most efficiently?

feedback.p: Incorrect. The terminal bronchioles contain cuboidal cells which provide a transitional area leading to the to the conduction zone of the alveoli. The conduction zone allows for the most efficient diffusion.
Correct. Type I alveolar cells are examples of squamous cells. Squamous cells are thin enough to allow the diffusion of gasses to be efficient.
Incorrect. These multiple layers of cells provide protection from abrasion but the thickness of the layers would slow down diffusion.
Incorrect. Although these cells only have one layer they are columnar shaped which increase the distance for diffusion and would slow it down.

body.p: Which group of cells indicates cell types that are known to contain goblet cells?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Stratified cells have many layers. The terminal bronchioles is an example of cuboidal cells that are a transition from the pseudostratified cells of the bronchial tree to the conduction zone of the alveoli.
Incorrect. Type I alveolar cells are an example of a single layer of squamous cells located in the alveoli. Surfactant is secreted in the alveoli not mucus.
Correct. The nares have stratified epithelial cells. These multiple layers of cells provide protection from abrasion.
Incorrect. Although these cells appear to be aligned in different layers they actually all touch the basement membrane and are only pseudostratified.

body.p: Which group of cells indicates cuboidal cells?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Terminal bronchioles example of cuboidal cells that are a transition from the pseudostratified cells of the bronchial tree that contain goblet cells.
Incorrect. Type I alveolar cells are an example of a single layer of squamous cells located in the alveoli. Surfactant is secreted in the alveoli not mucus.
Incorrect. Pseudostratified cells which contain goblet cells all touch the basement membrane. These stratified epithelial cells are actually multiple layers of cells provide protection from abrasion.

Correct. The bronchial tree is an example of pseudostratified epithelial. These cells actually all touch the basement membrane. Some are goblet cells which secrete mucus and many are ciliated cells which help move particles and bacteria out of the lungs.
